definitions: curved section of coastline forming a broad open bay
loop of rope or cable used for securing or attaching
examples: Ships often anchor in the protected bight during storms
The Great Australian Bight stretches for hundreds of miles
He secured the boat with a bight around the cleat
The sailor made several bights in the mooring line

definitions: person who strongly dislikes people with different beliefs or backgrounds
examples: The religious bigot refused to accept other faiths
She confronted the bigot about his racist comments

definitions: unreasonable attachment to negative beliefs about people who are different
examples: The community worked together to fight against bigotry
His bigotry prevented him from making new friends

definitions: person who rides motorcycles as hobby or lifestyle
person who rides bicycles for sport or recreation
examples: The leather-clad biker roared down the highway
Bikers gathered at the annual motorcycle rally
The mountain biker navigated the steep forest trail
Several bikers competed in the weekend cycling race

definitions: women's swimsuit consisting of separate top and bottom pieces
examples: She bought a colorful bikini for the beach vacation
The store displayed various bikini styles for summer

definitions: yellowish fluid produced by liver to help digest fats
feeling of anger or resentment expressed through harsh words
examples: The doctor explained how bile helps break down fatty foods
Bile from the gallbladder aids in the digestive process
His speech was filled with bile toward his opponents
She couldn't hide the bile in her bitter remarks

definitions: lowest part of ship's hull where water collects
foolish or worthless talk that makes no sense
examples: The crew pumped water from the bilge every morning
Foul-smelling bilge water accumulated in the ship's bottom
Don't believe that bilge about instant weight loss
He dismissed the conspiracy theory as complete bilge

definitions: person who can speak and understand two languages fluently
examples: The bilingual teacher easily switched between English and Spanish
Many bilinguals work as translators or interpreters

definitions: ability to speak two languages fluently or state of using two languages
examples: Bilingualism offers cognitive benefits throughout life stages
The school promotes bilingualism through immersion programs

definitions: isolated pond or small lake formed when river changes course
examples: Kangaroos gathered to drink at the billabong
The dried billabong filled with water after heavy rains

definitions: large outdoor board for displaying advertisements or announcements
examples: The new movie was advertised on billboards citywide
Digital billboards changed messages every thirty seconds

definitions: temporary accommodation for soldiers in civilian buildings
thick bar of metal ready for further processing
examples: Soldiers received billets in local homes during training
The officer arranged billets for the visiting troops
Steel billets were heated before being rolled into sheets
The foundry produced aluminum billets for manufacturing

definitions: process of preparing and sending statements of charges owed
order in which performers' names appear in advertisements
examples: The hospital's billing department processed insurance claims
Monthly billing statements arrived by email
She received top billing in the Broadway show
The billing order caused disputes among the actors

definitions: person whose wealth equals or exceeds one billion monetary units
examples: The tech billionaire donated millions to education
Several billionaires pledged to give away their fortunes

definitions: metal pot used for boiling water when camping
short wooden club carried by police officers
examples: He boiled water in the billy for making tea
The old billy hung from a branch over the campfire
The officer carried a billy on his belt
Police billies were standard equipment decades ago

definitions: offensive term for woman considered attractive but lacking intelligence
examples: The movie stereotype of the blonde bimbo is outdated
She resented being dismissed as just another bimbo

definitions: magazine or publication issued twice each month
magazine or publication issued once every two months
examples: The bimonthly newsletter arrived on the first and fifteenth
Subscribers received their bimonthly magazine regularly
The bimonthly journal published six issues per year
Our bimonthly meeting happens in January, March, and May

definitions: container used for storing or disposing of various items
examples: She threw the wrapper in the recycling bin
Storage bins kept the garage organized and tidy

definitions: system or code using only two symbols or states
examples: Computers process information using binary code
The binary star system contained two orbiting suns

definitions: folder with rings or clips for holding loose papers
substance that holds other materials together
examples: Students organized their notes in three-ring binders
The leather binder contained important legal documents
Egg acts as a binder in many baking recipes
The paint binder helps pigments adhere to surfaces

definitions: material covering and protecting the edge of a book
agreement or decision that legally requires compliance
examples: The leather binding protected the ancient manuscript
Gold lettering decorated the book's cloth binding
They signed a binding contract for the property
The court's binding decision ended the dispute

definitions: period of excessive indulgence in an activity, especially eating or drinking
examples: His weekend binge left him feeling sick and guilty
She went on a shopping binge after getting paid

definitions: game where players mark numbers on cards as they are called
examples: Residents played bingo every Thursday at the community center
She yelled bingo when she completed the winning pattern

definitions: scientist who studies chemical processes within living organisms
examples: The biochemist discovered a new enzyme in plant cells
Several biochemists worked together on the vaccine research

definitions: scientific study of chemical processes within and relating to living organisms
examples: She majored in biochemistry to pursue medical research
Biochemistry explains how proteins function in our bodies

definitions: measures and strategies to protect against biological weapons or naturally occurring diseases
examples: The government invested heavily in biodefense research programs
Biodefense protocols were activated during the outbreak

definitions: variety of plant and animal life in a particular habitat or on Earth
examples: The rainforest's biodiversity includes thousands of unique species
Conservation efforts aim to protect biodiversity worldwide

definitions: application of engineering principles to biological systems and medical technology
examples: Bioengineering advances produced artificial organs for transplants
The bioengineering lab developed new prosthetic limbs

definitions: technique using electronic monitoring to train control of bodily functions
examples: Biofeedback helped her manage chronic pain without medication
The therapist used biofeedback to treat stress-related disorders

definitions: study of the geographical distribution of plants and animals
examples: Biogeography explains why certain species exist only on islands
His biogeography research mapped migration patterns of birds

definitions: person who writes detailed accounts of other people's lives
examples: The biographer spent years researching the president's life
Several biographers competed to write the celebrity's story

definitions: detailed written account of a person's life and experiences
examples: The biography revealed unknown details about the artist
She read several biographies of historical figures

definitions: biological substance that poses threat to human health or living organisms
examples: Medical waste marked as biohazard required special disposal
Workers wore protective suits when handling biohazard materials

definitions: scientist who studies living organisms and their interactions with environment
examples: The marine biologist studied coral reef ecosystems
Several biologists collaborated on the conservation project

definitions: production and emission of light by living organisms through chemical reactions
examples: Fireflies create bioluminescence to attract potential mates
Deep sea creatures use bioluminescence for hunting prey

definitions: large naturally occurring community of plants and animals in major habitat
examples: The desert biome supports specially adapted plants and animals
Climate change threatens the delicate balance of Arctic biomes

definitions: medical science that applies biological and physiological principles to clinical practice
examples: Biomedicine research led to breakthrough cancer treatments
The biomedicine conference featured latest genetic therapy advances

definitions: medical procedure removing small tissue sample for diagnostic examination
examples: The doctor ordered a biopsy to check for cancer
Biopsy results confirmed the diagnosis within three days

definitions: use of living organisms to remove or neutralize pollutants from contaminated sites
examples: Bioremediation bacteria cleaned oil from the polluted beach
The company used bioremediation to restore contaminated soil

definitions: principles and practices for safe handling of biological materials and organisms
examples: Laboratory biosafety protocols prevented accidental contamination
The biosafety committee reviewed all genetic modification experiments

definitions: any science that deals with living organisms and life processes
examples: The university's bioscience department attracted top researchers
Bioscience innovations improved agricultural crop yields

definitions: regions of Earth's surface and atmosphere where living organisms exist
examples: Human activities increasingly impact the global biosphere
The biosphere extends from ocean depths to mountain peaks
